title.narrative: Protecting and Promoting the Food and Nutrition Security of VUlnerale Persons in Borno State Phase II

description.narrative: Action Against Hunger will target beneficiaries who will be receiving WASH, nutrition (Micronutrient supplements of a six-month ration for children between six months and two years old) and health support through other Action Against Hunger programs in order to maximize results. Action Against Hunger monitors food prices regularly to ensure that current market prices are calculated against food basket value and nutritional adequacy. Adjustments are made on transfer amounts to ensure that this does not fall to below the 50% threshold to support meeting food security objectives. Action Against Hunger will consult with FFP in developing specific courses of action and contingencies appropriate to level of possible market disruption.

In addition to Action Against Hunger’s scaled-up operation in April, AAH is again proposing to extend and scale-up its current FFP intervention to continue to meet immediate food needs and increase complementary nutrition programming in response to the 3254980 people in Borno. The project aims to foster improved nutrition security and reduced vulnerability of IDPs and vulnerable host communities in Borno state, Nigeria. Action Against Hunger will improve overall nutritional and food security status of vulnerable IDP and host community households, with a particular focus on pregnant and lactating women and children under five. This includes improved household food security and dietary diversity of IDPs and vulnerable host communities, and improved nutrition and care practices among pregnant and lactating women and children under five.
